marketNews.title: Snips Recap 2024: Another Year of Conglomerates
marketNews.content:
The Indonesian capital market in 2024 was again dominated by corporate actions from several conglomerates, followed by fantastic stock price increases from issuers affiliated with these conglomerates. This trend was seen in several conglomerates, such as Sugianto Kusuma (Aguan), Agoes Projosasmito, Prajogo Pangestu (Barito Group and Petrindo), Thohir Group, Lippo Group, and MNC Group. The following is a breakdown of corporate actions along with stock returns during 2024 owned by some of these conglomerates:

Sugianto Kusuma (Aguan)

- Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua ($PANI): +227%
  - August: held a private placement of IDR 6.5 Trillion to acquire 239 hectares of land from an affiliated party.
  - December: announced the IPO of its subsidiary ($CBDK) targeting fund acquisition of approximately IDR 1.7-2.3 Trillion.
- Stock returns affiliated with Sugianto Kusuma (Aguan) conglomerate: $INPC +193%, $JIHD +214%.

Agoes Projosasmito

- Amman Mineral Internasional ($AMMN): +29%
  - September: inaugurated a smelter worth IDR 21 Trillion with an input capacity of 900,000 tons of concentrate per year in West Nusa Tenggara.
- Bumi Resources Minerals ($BRMS): +104%
  - December: announced higher-grade gold reserves in the River Reef and Hill Reel mines in Palu.
- Bumi Resources ($BUMI): +39%
  - April: planned to seek approval for a quasi reorganization to eliminate the US$2.35 billion retained earnings deficit as of 2023. However, this plan was later removed from the agenda of the GMS-EGM in June 2024.

Prajogo Pangestu (PP)

- Petrosea ($PTRO): +426%
  - June: $CUAN through its subsidiary, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, increased its ownership by 7.5% of $PTRO shares worth ~IDR 207.9 Billion from PT Caraka Reksa Optima.
  - December: approved a stock split plan with a 1:10 ratio, with the trading schedule for shares with new nominal values in the regular and negotiation markets on January 3, 2025.
- Barito Renewables Energy ($BREN): +24%
  - May: IDX set BREN stock trading to be conducted by full periodic call auction (FCA).
  - September: entered the FTSE Global Equity Series - Large Cap index, but was later removed due to concentrated share ownership, with 4 shareholders controlling 97% of the company's shares.
- Chandra Asri Pacific ($TPIA): +43%
  - May: announced that its joint venture with Glencore plc signed an agreement to acquire all shares of Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Singapore (SECP) from Shell Singapore Pte. Ltd..
  - May: entered the MSCI Global Standard Indexes.
  - August: $TPIA Director, Suryandi, stated that the company is opening opportunities to take its infrastructure subsidiary, PT Chandra Daya Investasi, public.
- Stock returns affiliated with Prajogo Pangestu conglomerate: CUAN -17%, $BRPT -31%.

Lippo Group

- September: $LPKR through its subsidiary, PT Megapratama Karya Persada, sold ~18.6% of $SILO shares to Sight Investment Company Pte. Ltd. worth ~IDR 6.9 Trillion.
- Stock returns affiliated with Lippo Group: $MLPT +1,078%, $MLPL +30%, and LPKR +5%.

Grup MNC

- September: became an investor in the private placement of $RAAM by taking 619.4 million (10%) shares worth ~IDR 310 Billion.
- October: $MSIN conducted a stock split with a 1:5 ratio.
- December: $KPIG reached an agreement to divest the MNC Bali Resort land asset in Bali to PT Bumi Indah Prima for IDR 5.5 Trillion.
- Stock returns affiliated with MNC Group: KPIG +140%, MSIN +40%.

Grup Sinar Mas

- July: $DSSA conducted a stock split with a 1:10 ratio.
- Stock returns affiliated with Sinarmas Group: DSSA +363%, $GEMS +83%.

Grup Thohir

- September: $ADRO announced it would spin-off its thermal coal business under $AADI through a public offering scheme by shareholders (PUPS). Along with this PUPS, $AADI also conducted an IPO in December 2024.
- Stock returns affiliated with Thohir Group: ADRO +2.1%, AADI +44%, $ADMR -12%, $TRIM +26%, and $ESSA +53%.

marketNews.title: Corporate Actions Throughout 2024
marketNews.content:
1Q24

- January
  - $RAJA: through its subsidiary acquired an 8% participating interest in the Jabung block from PT GPI Jabung.
  - $KARW: PT Saranakelola Investa bought 80.19% of $KARW shares from ICTSI Far East Limited Pte. Ltd. worth ~IDR 31 Billion. $KARW changed its name to Meratus Jasa Prima in May 2024.

- February
  - $INCO: the mining State-Owned Enterprise holding, MIND ID, acquired 14% of $INCO shares at a price of IDR 3,050/share.
  - $WIKA: reached a master restructuring agreement worth IDR 24.79 Trillion.
  - $GGRM: through its subsidiary obtained a concession period for the Kediri-Tulungagung toll road for 50 years, targeted to start operating in 3Q25.
- March
  - $UNTR: through its subsidiary plans to acquire the geothermal company PT Supreme Energy Rantau Dedap for US$80.69 million.
  - $FORU: IMR Asia Holding acquired 77.7% of $FORU shares worth IDR 45.29 Billion.
  - Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, announced a consolidation plan for State-Owned Construction Companies from 7 companies to 3 companies, with the entities surviving after the merger being $ADHI, $PTPP, and PT Hutama Karya. This corporate action has not materialized despite initially being planned for completion in October 2024.
  - $EMTK: through its subsidiary plans to acquire 41.15% of $CASS shares worth IDR 704.1 Billion. This corporate action was completed in April 2024.

2Q24

- April
  - $HRUM: through its subsidiary acquired 51% of Blue Sparkling Energy shares - an HPAL smelter developer that will operate in 2026 - for ~US$206.2 million. $HRUM also signed a memorandum of understanding for strategic cooperation with Eternal Tsingshan Group Ltd..
  - $SSIA: BYD announced the purchase of 108 hectares of land in the Subang Smartpolitan industrial estate owned by $SSIA. Previously, BYD launched products in Indonesia in early 2024.
- May
  - Starlink obtained an operating permit in Indonesia to become an internet service provider for retail consumers.
- June
  - $PYFA: through its subsidiary, acquired all shares of Probiotec Limited for ~AU$251 million, with part of the financing using proceeds from a rights issue of ~IDR 1 Trillion in April 2024 and the remainder from bank debt.

3Q24

- July
  - $TOWR: through its subsidiary acquired 90.11% of [$IBST]() worth IDR 3.42 Trillion.
  - $JSMR: divested 35% of PT Jasamarga Transjawa Tol shares worth US$960.3 million to a consortium of Metro Pacific Tollways Corp and GIC Pte. Ltd..
  - $DOID: through its business entity acquired the anthracite mine, Atlantic Carbon Group, for US$122.4 million.
  - $TPMA: acquired 65% of PT Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah shares from an affiliated party for US$32.5 million, which is part of the IDR 406.5 Billion rights issue in July 2024.
  - VinFast started the groundbreaking of a factory worth US$200 million in Subang, targeted to operate in 4Q25.
  - $TOTL: Shimizu Corporation held a voluntary tender offer for 19.9% of $TOTL shares, but there is no further update regarding this corporate action.
  - $BKSL: Genting Plantations Bhd. plans to purchase 152 hectares of land from $BKSL and third parties for ~IDR 2 Trillion.
- August
  - $BSDE: plans to acquire 91.99% of [$SMDM]() shares for ~IDR 2.4 Trillion, with the transaction completed in October 2024.
  - $DOID: through its subsidiary acquired 5.07% of 29Metals Ltd. shares for ~AU$12.5 million.
  - $FILM: plans to acquire 80.05% of [$NETV]() shares for ~IDR 1.7 Trillion, with the transaction completed in October 2024.
  - $BNBR: completed the quasi reorganization process to eliminate the IDR 19.5 Trillion equity deficit.
  - $ACES: did not extend the license agreement with Ace Hardware Corporation, which expires on December 31, 2024.
  - $LABA: is exploring cooperation with electric motorcycle producer ECGO and plans to invest in land and buildings covering Â±40 hectares.
- September
  - $TPMA: established a joint venture named PT Trans Ocean Permata which will acquire 20 sets of tugboats and barges and 2 floating crane units with a capex of US$90 million.
  - $HRUM: shareholders approved the buyback of 849 million (6.4%) shares with a maximum fund of IDR 1 Trillion until September 17, 2025.

4Q24

- October
  - $LEAD: held a private placement for debt conversion of US$20 million.
  - $ENRG: through its subsidiary signed an agreement to acquire 51% participating rights in the Sengkang Block, South Sulawesi.
  - $ANTM: through its subsidiary acquired 30% of Tsingshan Group's business entity shares - PT Jiu Long Metal Industry - for US$102.5 million.
  - $PNBN: Reuters reported that the Gunawan family and ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. are considering plans to divest $PNBN. The controlling Gunawan family owns 46.52% of $PNBN shares, while ANZ owns 39.22%.
- November
  - $TOBA: acquired 100% of the shares of waste management company Sembcorp Environment Pte. Ltd. for S$405 million.
  - $DOID: through its business entity signed an agreement to acquire 51% of the shares of the metallurgical coal mine Dawson Complex for US$455 million.
  - $ABMM: through its subsidiary signed an agreement to acquire 99.9% of shares in 2 subsidiaries of $CTBN.
  - $PACK: plans to change its name to Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama and change its business activities to nickel trading holding company activities. $PACK estimates that this business activity change will increase net profit to IDR 346 Billion in 2025.
- December
  - $UNVR: signed an agreement to divest its ice cream business for IDR 7 Trillion.
  - $EXCL: announced a definitive agreement to merge with $FREN, where the name $EXCL will become XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera.
  - []()[]()$RAJA: subsidiary, Raharja Energi Cepu ($RATU), plans an IPO of 20% shares at a price of IDR 900-1,150/share.
  - $NCKL: acquired 10% of PT Obi Nickel Cobalt shares from an affiliated party for ~IDR 2.1 Trillion.
  - $KARW: the controller sold ~5.4 million $KARW shares at an average price of IDR 6,376/share to expand the retail investor ownership base.
  - $TPMA: together with $KKGI established a joint venture named PT Trans Bahtera Pioneer.
  - $MDIY: operator MR.D.I.Y, Daya Intiguna Yasa, held an IPO of 10% shares at a price of IDR 1,650/share.

*Although stock transactions are subject to the PPN increase to 12% starting January 2025, Stockbit customers need not worry because the transaction fees for buying and selling on Stockbit remain the same, which is 0.15% for buying and 0.25% for selling.

tickerNews.content: March: Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, announced a consolidation plan for State-Owned Construction Companies from 7 companies to 3 companies, with the entities surviving after the merger being $ADHI, $PTPP, and PT Hutama Karya. This corporate action has not materialized despite initially being planned for completion in October 2024.
